thread.title: Social Security Q&A: Will the Earnings Test Hit Work after 66?
thread.title_full: Social Security Q&A: Will the Earnings Test Hit Work after 66? - Forbes

author: Laurence Kotlikoff
title: Social Security Q&A: Will the Earnings Test Hit Work after 66?
text:
Social Security may be one of your largest assets. What and when you collect will make a huge difference to your lifetime benefits.
Today’s Social Security question is about the reach of the earnings test.
Question : I am collecting Social Security disability and am thinking about finding a job if I can. I will turn 66 in August. What will happen if I do go to work right now? Do I lose all of what I am getting from Social Security now?
Answer : Social Security’s earnings test stops the minute you reach full retirement age. So, after August, you can earn as much as you’d like without losing any of your Social Security benefits.
My weekly Social Security column appears on PBS NEWSHOUR’s website .
